quotes.quote: Everybody needs beauty as well as bread, places to play in and pray in, where nature may heal and give strength to body and soul.
There are no words that can tell the hidden spirit of the wilderness, that can reveal its mystery, its melancholy, and its charm.
And Reality is hard. It is no walk in the park, this thing called life.
Parks are but pavement disguised with a growth of grass.
Parks are idealizations of nature, but nature in fact is not a condition of the ideal.
Within National Parks is room, glorious room, room in which to find ourselves, in which to think and hope, to dream and plan, to rest and resolve.
The scenic ideals that surround even our national parks are carriers of a nostalgia for heavenly bliss and eternal calmness.
The world is a playground, and death is the night
Parks and playgrounds are the soul of a city.
It is the child in man that is the source of his uniqueness and creativeness, and the playground is the optimal milieu for the unfolding of his capacities and talents.
Make your race a playground, not a proving ground.
A national park is not a playground. It's a sanctuary for nature and for humans who will accept nature on nature's own terms.
Behind every great amusement park is a great fan site.
Preserving parks and open spaces is a winner because it doesn't need to be explained to everyday Americans.
The true object of all human life is play. Earth is a task garden; heaven is a playground.
They say a happy childhood is a lousy preparation for life. Kids who spend their playground days fat, ginger or gay know the truth.
